revised_title: The Role of Oxalates and Citrates in Blood Coagulation and Hemolysis Inhibition
tldr: The authors investigated the effects of oxalates and citrates on blood coagulation and hemolysis. They found that these substances inhibit clotting and protect against hemolysis by interacting with serum. The study also showed that the presence of calcium chloride can restore coagulability and lytic action. This research sheds light on the relationship between clotting and hemolysis and has implications for understanding blood coagulation.
